intro: Lachenalia anguinea, commonly known as the angular lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often with red or purple markings. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia anguinea is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
